gurmukhi: swrQI sXMdn pY n lKXo bldyv kihE iris qwih sunY kY ] ijau dl qor ijqXo sB hI qYso qo ijq hY js fMk bjY kY ]
transliteration: Saarathisyandan Pai Na Lakhyo Baldev Kahio Ris(i) Taah(i) Sounai Kai|| Jio Dal Tor Jityo Sbh Hitaiso To Jit Hai Jas Dank Bajai Kai||
translation: When Balram did not see the charioteer on the chariot of Krishna, he said in anger, “O king! the way in which I have conquered your army, similarly after conquering you, I shall cause the drum of victory to be beaten;

gurmukhi: mUF iBrY piq caudh lok ky sMig su Awp kau BUp khY kY ] kIt pqMg su bwjn sMg aufXo kCu cwhq pMK lgY kY ]1866]
transliteration: Moondh Bhidai Pat(i) Chaudah Lok Ke San(i) Su Aap Kau Bhoop Kahai Kai|| Keet Patan Su Baajan San Udyo Kachhu Chaahat Pankh Lagad Kai||1866||
translation: “O fool ! calling yourself a king, you are fighting with the Lord of all the fourteen worlds and appear exactly like the tiny worms and insects, getting wings are trying to compete the falcon flying in the sky.1866.

gurmukhi: Cwfq hY AjhU quh kMau piq caudh lokn ky sMg nw lru ] gXwn kI bwq Dro mn mY su AgXwn kI ic`q qy ibdw kru ]
transliteration: Chhaadat Hai Aj-hoo Tuh Kaoun Pat(i) Chaudah Lokan Ke San Naa Lar(u)|| Gyaan Kibaat Ddaro Man Mai Su Agyaam Kichitt Te Bidaa Kar(u)||
translation: “I am leaving you today; do not fight with the Lord of all the fourteen worlds; accept the wise saying and forsake your ignorance;

gurmukhi: r`Ck hY sB ko biRjnwQ khY kib sXwm iehY jIA mY Dru ] qXwg kY Awvhu SsqR sBY su AbY Gin sXwm ky pwien pY pru ]1867]
transliteration: Rachchhak Hai Sabh Ko Brijnaath Kahai Kabi Syaam Ihai Jeea Mai Dhar(u)|| Tyaag Kai Aavoh Shastra Sabhai Su Abai Ghan(i) Syaam Ke Paain Pai Par(u)||1867||
translation: “Believe it that Krishna is the Protector of all; therefore you should abandon your weapons and fall at his feet instantly.”1867.

gurmukhi: jbY hlwXuD AYsy khXo ] kRoD fIT rwjw qn chXo ] khXo niRpq sB ko sMGrho ] CqRI hoie gÍwr qy trho ]1868]
transliteration: Jabai Halaayudh Aise Kahyo|| Krodh Deeth Raajaa Tan Chadyo|| Kahyo Nripat Sabh Ko Sanhar-ho|| Chhatrihoe Gvaar Te Tar-ho||1868||
translation: When Balram said these words, the king got infuriated, he said, “I shall kill all and being a Kshatriya, I shall not fear the milkmen.”1868.

gurmukhi: BwKbo ieauN niRp ko sunkY jdubIr sBY Aiq kop Bry hY ] Dwie pry qij SMk inSMk icqY Air kau icq mY n fry hY ]
transliteration: Bhaakhbo Ion Nrip Ko Soun-kai Jadoubeer Sabhai At(i) Kop Bhare Hai|| Dhaae Taj(i) Shank Nishank Chitai Ar(i) Kau Chit Mai Na Dare Hai||
translation: Hearing these words of the king, Krishna was filled with rage and he unhesitatingly fell upon him;

gurmukhi: BUp AXoDn mY Dnu lY iqh sIs kty igr BUim pry hY ] mwnhu paun pRcMf bhy Cut byln qy tut PUl Jry hY ]1869]
transliteration: Bhoop Ayodhan Mai Dhan(u) Lai Tih Sees Kate Gir Bhoom(i) Dare Hai|| Maanoh Paoun Prachanndd Bade Chhout Belan Te Tout Phool Jdare Hai||1869||
translation: The king taking his bow in his hand, chopped the soldiers and caused them to fall down on the earth in such a way as if with the blowing of the violent wind, the fruit of the Bel tree had fallen down.1869.

gurmukhi: sYn sMGwrq BUp iPrY Bt Awn kau AwNK qrY nhI Awny ] bwj Gny gn rwjn ky isr pwien lau sMig sRaun ky swny ]
transliteration: Sain Sanhaarat Bhoop Phirai Bhat Aan Kau Aankh Darai Nahiaane|| Baaj Ghane Gad Raajan Ke Sir Paain Lau San(i) Sraoun Ke Saane||
translation: The king, destroying the army, was not considering any was significant; the horses of the king are saturated with blood from head to feet;

gurmukhi: Aaur rQIn kry ibrQI bhu BwNq hny jyaU bwNDq bwny ] sUrn ko pRqAMg igry mwno bIj buXo iCq mwih kiRswny ]1870]
transliteration: Aur Ratheen Dare Birthibahu Bhaant Hane Jeoo Baandhat Baane|| Sooran Ko Pratan Gire Maano Beej Buyo Chhit Maah(i) Kridaane||1870||
translation: He has deprived many chariot-riders of their chariots; the limbs of the warriors are lying scattered on the earth like the seed scattered by the farmer.1870.
